title: How will psychiatry change in 50 years? - Quora

response.answer_text: Assuming things remain relatively stable, I think that we will learn more about physical consciousness and how chemicals in the brain interact. This will allow for better treatments for the mentally ill. Right now, it’s still a bit of a dark art, with doctors and patients working over time with different pharmaceuticals. That’s what I needed to do, and am now stable. I’m 56 and it’s taken a good part of my life to accomplish I wouldn’t trade my stability for anything now, but, it would have been nice to have been able to arrive there sooner.

Who knows? We probably will know more about the network of networks of networks that is the brain. Hopefully we will be better able to individualize or medicine treatments, which presently are somewhat hit or miss. We might develop better tools and techniques for psychological learning, or “unlearning” harmful or destructive memories and patterns. We might know more about “consciousness.” We might have more capability to understand and interact with creatures who have brains that function quite differently than ours. Or, unless Captain Picard saves us, we might all be “assimilated into the hive.”
